intro: Haplophyllum eugenii-korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's haplophyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath or heather family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
